input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Ben: OK, Mrs Thomas. I finished cleaning up the leaves in the yard.
Max: Oh, thank you, James.
Ben: I also swept the front steps and took out the garbage. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Max: Can you also take my dog Oscar for a walk?
Ben: Sure.
Max: Here is such a prince. Ever since I broke my leg i t has been so difficult to take care of things around the house. My daughter Leah helps out on Mondays and Tuesdays and my son Robbie on Thursdays, but I'm so happy you can come on Saturdays.
Ben: Well, I appreciate the weekend work. I'm saving up to buy a bike so I can ride to my basketball practice.
Max: Will you still be able to work for me after you get your bike?
Ben: Of course, but don't forget I'm away next weekend visiting my grandfather. My sister Allison will come by instead.
Max: OK.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: Max is a senior citizen who lives alone and has a broken leg. She was in need of help with chores around the house, so she hired Ben to come on Saturdays to assist her. Ben is happy to do the work to save up for a bike. Max is grateful for Ben's assistance and asks if he will still be available to work for her after he gets his bike. Ben explains that his sister Allison will be available the following weekend instead, but he will continue to work for Max after that.
input_text.Response B: Ben helped Max with some housework on Saturdays. Ben is saving up to buy a bike for his basketball practice. Ben will still work for Max after he gets his bike. Ben is away next weekend visiting his grandfather. His sister Allison will come by instead.
